Nerangs.ab: aməṣ̌ā spəṇtā (Y25.0) hāwan abāz wardēnišn huxšaϑrā huδā̊ŋhō yazamaide iməm haōməm (Y25.1) hōm ud urwarām andar hāwan abganišn aṣ̌aiia uzdātəm ...

"At aməṣ̌ā spəṇtā (Y25.0), he has to turn the hāwan right side (and continue with) huxšaϑrā huδā̊ŋhō yazamaide. At iməm haōməm (Y25.1), he has to throw the hōm and urwarām into the hāwan (and continue with) aṣ̌aiia uzdātəm ..."
iməm haōməm hōm ud urwarām andar hāwan abganišn aṣ̌aiia uzdātəm ...
"At iməm haōməm, he has to throw the hōm and urwarām into the hāwan (and continue with) aṣ̌aiia uzdātəm..."

Quotations.ab: u-š pad iməm haōməm hōm ud urwarām andar hāwan abganēd
"At iməm haōməm, he throws the hōm and urwarām into the hāwan."

ModernPractice.ab: "The chief priest, after striking the inverted mortar on the table three times, turns it upright, and wiping the inside by hand, cleans (it). The chief priest puts the hom twigs into the mortar. imǝm haomǝm aṣ̌aiia uzdātǝm yazamaide. He pours the milk into the mortar. imąmcā gąm jīuuiiąm aṣ̌aiia uzdātąm yazamaide imąmcā uruuarąm haδānaēpatąm aṣ̌aiia uzdātąm yazamaide".

ab.ab: "With his right hand he picks up the three hōm twigs from the saucer and drops them into the mortar, saying "We revere this hōm offered with righteousness" (imem haomem ashaya uzdātem yazamaidē). With the words "We revere this mixture of milk and consecrated water offered with righteousness" (imāmcha gām jīvyām ashaya uzdātām yazamaidē), the zōt picks up the cup located near the base of the barsom stand and pours a small amount of the goat's milk into the mortar, then returns the cup to its place. As he says the next phrases, "and we revere the pomegranate tree offered with righteousness" (imāmcha urvarām hadhānaēpatām ashaya uzdātām yazamaidē), the zōt picks up the pomegranate twig from the saucer and drops it into the mortar",
